Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Arch Deacon Bernard Young, Episcopal Arch Deacon of Queens and Rector of St. Albans the Martyr, St. Albans Queens.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER COMRIE.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by the Venerable ArchDeacon Rev. Bernard O.D. Young, Espiscopal ArchDeacon of Queens and Rector of St. Alban the Matyr, St. Albans Queens.

Council Member _____ moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 9, 2003 be adopted and printed by Council Member Katz.
Items.MinutesNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 9, 2003 be adopted as printed by Council Member Katz.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed and reporting upon the use of a traffic-control signal photo-monitoring system and to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989, amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the duration of the application of provisions of such code, such chapter and such law." A.4806-A / S.2472-A
Items.MatterName: Traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices. (A.4806-A, S.2472-A)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on General Welfare

Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to hold an oversight hearing on the planning, procedures and practices of the Department of Homeless Services in siting homeless shelters in New York City.
Items.MatterName: Planning, procedures and practices of the Department of Homeless Services in siting homeless shelters in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Commission on Human Rights to increase its efforts to protect the rights of military service members under the City's Human Rights Law including, without limitation, by working with other appropriate City agencies to notify landlords of applicable legal obligations and calling upon Congress to pass legislation to prohibit discrimination in the rental of housing to members of the armed forces.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted unanimously by voice voice.
Items.MatterName: Commission on Human Rights to increase its efforts to protect the rights of military service members.

Items.Title: General Orders Calendar
Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the displaying of the POW/MIA flag
Items.MatterName: POW/MIA Flag Displaying

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the rights and dignity of domestic workers.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice vote.  The following 2 Council Members formally abstained from voting on this item: Council Members Gallagher and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the rights and dignity of domestic workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the standards of conduct of employment agencies and employers of domestic or household employees placed by employment agencies.
Items.MatterName: Standards and Conduct of employment agencies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York State Governor George Pataki and the New York State Legislature to restructure the Board of Directors of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to include voting members representing the riding public and labor.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted unanimously by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Restructure the Bd of Directors of the MTA to include voting members representing the riding public and labor.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the enactment of New York State Senate bill, S.1008, that would establish a Metropolitan Transportation Authority operating oversight committee which would be responsible for reviewing all financial records and operating budget proposals of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted unanimously by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish an MTA operating oversight committee.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the landmark Settlement Agreement in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York, which provides mentally ill prison inmates with all the benefits of an adequate discharge plan prior to and/or immediately upon release from City prisons or jails, as mandated in Justice Richard Braun's 2000 ruling, which ruling was unanimously affirmed by the New York State Supreme Court, Appellate Division, First Department, and denied leave to appeal to the New York Court of Appeals.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disabilities Services
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice vote.  The folowing  2 Council Members formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Members Gallager and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Support of the proposed landmark Settlement Agreement in the case of Brad H. v. The City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor of the State of New York to direct the Metropolitan Transportation Authority board to rescind its approval of the recent transit fare increase.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted unanimously by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Direct the MTA board to rescind its approval of the recent transit fare increase.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the legislature and the Governor of the State of New York to enact legislation preventing the Metropolitan Transportation Authority from authorizing any future fare increase until the Comptroller of the State of New York reviews its financial plan to determine whether a fare increase is reasonable or necessary.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted unanimously by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Preventing the MTA from authorizing any future fare increase until the Comptroller of the NYS reviews its financial plan.

Items.Title: Resolution approving with a modification the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C  010721 PPK, the disposition of eighteen (18) city-owned properties located at 2285 Pacific Street (Block 1435/Lot 72), 2281 Pacific Street (Block 1435/Lot 74), 2281 Pacific Street (Block 1435/Lot 75) and 2279 Pacific Street (Block 1435/Lot 76); 2331 Dean Street (Block 1442/Lot 61) and 2325 Dean Street (Block 1442/Lot 63); 1832 Sterling Place (Block 1471/Lot 31); 1680 St. Johns Place (Block 1473/Lot 14); 946-60 Saratoga Avenue (Block 1492/Lot 6); Hull Street (Block 1534/Lot 42); 71-A Somers Street (Block 1539/Lot 73); 84 Mother Gaston Boulevard (Block 1542/Lot 33), 86 Mother Gaston Boulevard (Block 1542/Lot34), 88 Mother Gaston Boulevard (Block 1542/Lot 35), 90 Mother Gaston Boulevard (Block 1542/Lot 36), and 92 Mother Gaston Boulevard (Block 1542/Lot 37); 39 Dumont Avenue (Block 3551/Lot 54); 791 Saratoga Avenue (Block 3583/Lot 27), Brooklyn (L.U. Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to install video cameras in every subway station where a token booth will be closed and calls upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold a hearing on the issue.
Items.MatterName: MTA to install video cameras in every subway station where a token booth will be closed.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the department of correction and probation.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the department of correction and probation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for the extension of Article 15-A of the New York State Executive Law by the New York State Legislature and the passage by the Legislature of New York State Assembly Bills A.805, establishing state agency goal submission procedures, A.6749, establishing an Article 15-A implementation fund, and A.6750, requiring a report on the effectiveness of the provisions of Article 15-A by the appropriate state agency, as it relates to the participation of minority group members and women in respect to state and city contracts.
Items.MatterName: Extension of Article 15-A of the NYS Executive Law by the NYS Legislature.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring institutions that provide payday loan or grant services and which conduct business with the city or its agencies, to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure in advertisements regarding material information, such as interest rates and other charges, so that consumers understand the true costs of these loans.
Items.MatterName: Payday loan or grant services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payday loans.
Items.MatterName: In relation to payday loans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly bill A.6495 and State Senate bill S.111, which would amend the Real Property Tax Law to allow water rate relief to benefit senior citizens residing in cities with populations of one million or more.
Items.MatterName: Water rate relief to benefit senior citizens residing in cities with populations of one million or more.  (S.111, A.6495)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to enact legislation to amend the current federal banking laws in order to better protect consumers from the dangers of payday loans.
Items.MatterName: Amend the current federal banking laws to better protect consumers from the dangers of payday loans.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the month of June 2003, and the month of June of every year thereafter, as Water Safety Month in the City of New York and urging all New Yorkers and visitors, who plan to be near any water source, to apply water safety measures to prevent drownings and water-related injuries.
Items.MatterName: Water Safety Month in the City of New York, June 2003

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to adopt amendments to the penal law, to ensure that drunk drivers are held fully accountable for the consequences of their actions, including removal of criminal negligence as an element of proof borne by the prosecution to prove vehicular manslaughter and vehicular assault in the case of a driver who is legally intoxicated.
Items.MatterName: Ensure that drunk drivers are held fully accountable for the consequences of their actions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the Charter of the city of New York, in relation to the department of homeless services.
Items.MatterName: In relation to the department of homeless services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to creation of a review process in the event of the closure of a publicly mapped street.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a review process in the event of the closure of a publicly mapped street.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to testing by the department of environmental protection for contaminants in the areas affected by the attacks on the world trade center.
Items.MatterName: DEP testing for contaminants in the areas affected by the attacks on the WTC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to authorizing the department of transportation to extend the expiration date of any franchise to operate and maintain bus shelters.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing DOT to extend the expiration date of any franchise to operate and maintain bus shelters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to internet cafes.
Items.MatterName: In relation to internet cafes.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to Section 19-511.1 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York to review forty-one determinations by the Taxi and Limousine Commission to approve applications for the renewal of a license to operate a base station and seven determinations to approve an application for a new license to operate a base station.
Items.MatterName: Base Station License

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States government to enact that portion of the United States Senate-adopted version of the President's economic stimulus package providing for $20 billion in state and local fiscal assistance, as well as to enact a national anti-recessionary revenue sharing program that would provide states and cities with direct federal assistance to mitigate the loss of revenues and increased service obligations during this current economic recession and other such recessions in the future.
Items.MatterName: U.S. Gov't to enact a national counter-cyclical revenue sharing program.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the United States government for taking threat information, critical infrastructure and population density into consideration when distributing homeland security and bioterrorism funding, and further calling upon the United States government to continue to account for such factors when distributing additional homeland security and bioterrorism funding and to distribute such funds directly to the City of New York and other high-risk localities across the nation.
Items.MatterName: Homeland Security Funding

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to reverse its decision to promulgate rules requiring the working poor to meet a higher standard of proof of eligibility for the Federal Earned Income Tax Credit than it requires for other tax benefits, and, if the IRS fails to reverse itself, calling upon Congress to act legislatively to stop the proposed action.
Items.MatterName: Federal Earned Income Tax Credit

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing penalties for illegal general vendors and food vendors.
Items.MatterName: Increasing penalties for illegal general vendors and food vendors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a civil cause of action against those who sell illegal or forged documents.
Items.MatterName: Create a civil cause of action against those who sell illegal or forged documents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing the city to clean graffiti without consent of the owner of the property.
Items.MatterName: Allowing city to clean graffiti without consent of property owner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to painting private driveway curb cuts yellow.
Items.MatterName: Painting private driveway curb cuts yellow.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Rent Guidelines Board not to approve any rent increase for rent-stabilized apartments until further study demonstrates that landlords' expenses are outpacing their profits.
Items.MatterName: NYC Rent Guidelines Board not to approve any rent increase for rent-stabilized apartments until further study.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.3480, to prohibit foreign banking corporations from issuing payday loans.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit foreign banking corporations from issuing payday loans.  (A3480)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Human Resources Administration (HRA) to request the automatic federal food stamp Able-Bodied Adults Without Dependent Children (ABAWD) waiver, which would extend food stamp benefits for non-disabled adults without dependents.
Items.MatterName: Automatic federal food stamp Able-Bodied Adults Without Dependent Children (ABAWD) waiver.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council to conduct an oversight hearing on the incidence of babies born with low birth weights and smaller skulls to African-American and Dominican women, who reside either in Upper Manhattan or the South Bronx, as a result of their exposure to air pollutants and pesticide used in schools and public housing in New York City.
Items.MatterName: Incidence of babies born with low birth weights and smaller skulls to African-American and Dominican women.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to enact A.3563, A.5760 and S.3458, which would amend the Education Law in relation to restricting school personnel from recommending the use of psychotropic drugs for children.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Education Law in relation to restricting school personnel from recommending the use of psychotropic drugs for children.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.147-A, and Assembly Member Pheffer, A.6619, "AN ACT to amend the surrogate's court procedure act, in relation to the compensation of the public administrators".
Items.MatterName: Surrogate's court procedure act (S.147-A, A.6619)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Skelos, S.2124-A, and Assembly Members DiNapoli, Hooper, Sidikman and Weisenberg, A.6064, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to allowing the transfer of membership from the New York city police pension fund to the metropolitan transportation authority police pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Allowing the transfer of membership from the NYC police pension fund to the metropolitan transportation authority police pension fund (S.2124-A, A.6064)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adding a plainly audible noise standard.
Items.MatterName: Adding a plainly audible noise standard.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services, and in the alternative, that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority require payday loan companies to disclose pertinent information in their advertisements.
Items.MatterName: MTA and its subsidiaries to stop the practice of leasing advertising space to businesses providing payday loan services.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the Iraqi lawyer, members of the US Marines, Navy SEALs, Army Rangers, and Air Force fliers who rescued Army private Jessica Lynch, and commending the United States Bureau of Citizenship and Immigration Services for granting Mohammed al-Rehaief, his wife and their 5-year-old daughter asylum.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commending all responsible for the rescue of Army private Jessica Lynch.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to lobbyist registration fees and certain city clerk fees.
Items.MatterName: Lobbyist registration fees and certain city clerk fees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to repeal section 27-4029 of the administrative code of the city of New York relating to exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits and inspections.
Items.MatterName: Exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits and inspections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative of the city of New York, in relation to increasing personal income and sales taxes.
Items.MatterName: Increasing personal income and sales taxes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties.
Items.MatterName: Imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties ("absentee landlord tax surcharge").

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the Brighton Beach Business Improvement District, and the setting of the time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such district.
Items.MatterName: Brighton Beach Business Improvement District

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing any member of the police force, while off-duty, to provide security at locations where alcohol is used or sold.
Items.MatterName: Allowing any member of the police force, while off-duty, to provide security at locations where alcohol is used or sold.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing auxiliary police officers, while off-duty, to provide security at locations where alcohol is used or sold.
Items.MatterName: Allowing auxiliary police officers, while off-duty, to provide security at locations where alcohol is used or sold.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to unsolicited material.
Items.MatterName: In relation to unsolicited material.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting requirements for housing tax benefit programs.
Items.MatterName: Reporting requirements for housing tax benefit programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law to allow any member of the police force, while off-duty, to provide security at locations where alcohol is used or sold.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law .

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend section 375 of the Vehicle and Traffic Law relating to the prohibition on attaching handbills and other advertisements upon car windshields by creating a rebuttable presumption that the person whose name, telephone number or other identifying information appears on the handbill or other advertisement was responsible for its distribution and by granting authority to New York City Sanitation police officers to enforce such law.
Items.MatterName: Amend Vehicle and Traffic Law relating to the prohibition on attaching handbills and other ads on car windshields.

Items.Title: Parks and Recreation
Roll Call

Resolution honoring the memory of over 400 Colonial Era remains of Africans uncovered during 1991 in Lower Manhattan, and calling upon the United States General Services Administration to immediately re-inter the remains of the 427 Africans that were unearthed and to construct a museum and memorial plaque to honor the historic and vitally important African Burial Ground.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice vote.  The following 2 Council Members formally abstained from voting on this item: Council Members Gallagher and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Honoring the memory of over 400 Colonial Era remains of Africans uncovered during 1991.
